ygData.subject: Re: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: A warrior would crush the pet. I had a human warrior friend who was only 45 at the time duel my pet she crushed it. Naeeldar ... From: Rokenn Swiftsong
ygData.messageBody:
A warrior would crush the pet. I had a human warrior friend who was only 45
at the time duel my pet she crushed it.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Rokenn Swiftsong <rokenn@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, January 28, 2000 10:25 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant


>From: "Rokenn Swiftsong" <rokenn@...>
>
>>From: <kim@...>
>>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>>Subject: RE: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant
>>Date: Thu, 27 Jan 2000 20:06:09 -0500 (EST)
>>
>>On Thu, 27 Jan 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>> >
>> > I do agree
>> > that a level 50 with the right equipment would beat the pet though.
>>Still a
>> > FBSS isn't all that common is it?
>>
>>No, Abashi is correct on this point. A L49 pet requires words
>>and components which are very rare and difficult to obtain -
>>roughly as difficult as or rarer than equipment like the FBSS.
>>A lot of the high level mages and necros are using lower level
>>pets because they simply haven't obtained the items needed for
>>their higher level pet spells. So the correct comparison is
>>between L49 pet and L49 warrior with equipment typical for
>>that level. (Actually, the correct comparison would be L49
>>necro and L49 pet vs L49 warrior. We're already being
>>massively conservative comparing the warrior to just the pet.)
>>
>>--
>>John H. Kim
>>kim@...
>>
>
>If the comparison is a straight up duel between a warrior and a necro then
>the obvious way to kill the pet is to kill the master :) If the warrior is
>dumb enough to sit there and melee the pet he deserves to lose.
>
>Rokenn
